<title
    level="1"
    right="Feat 12"
    pfs="Limited"
>
[Play to the Crowd](/Feats.aspx?ID=7637) <actions string="" />
</title>

<spoilers>May contain spoilers from Curtain Call</spoilers>

<traits>
<trait label="Uncommon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=159" />
<trait label="Archetype" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=12" />
<trait label="Skill" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=144" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Pathfinder #204: Stage Fright](/Sources.aspx?ID=245) pg. 82

**Archetype** [Dandy](/Archetypes.aspx?ID=246) (Level 12)

**Prerequisites**
[Dandy Dedication](/Feats.aspx?ID=6302); Master in [Deception](/Skills.aspx?ID=38)

</column>

---

You have a knack for knowing just how to manipulate groups by saying exactly what needs to be said. When you Lie in a public area in front of a crowd, you can gauge the reactions of the crowd as you speak to know how your [Lie](/Actions.aspx?ID=2389) is working, and Lie loses its [secret](/Traits.aspx?ID=690) trait. You gain the Reactive Falsehood reaction.

**Reactive Falsehood** <actions string="Reaction" /> ([fortune](/Traits.aspx?ID=612)) **Frequency** once per hour; **Trigger** You fail to Lie to a creature in public; Effect As your target sees through your lie, you spin your falsehood in a way that utilizes the crowd’s reaction to bolster believability. Re-roll your [Deception](/Skills.aspx?ID=38) check to Lie with a +2 status bonus and use this check’s result as the actual result to Lie.
name: Play to the Crowd
